text.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Controlled Dangerous Substances law" means Title 5 of the Criminal Law Article.

"Final disposition" means a dismissal, entry of a nolle prosequi, the marking of a criminal charge "stet" on the docket, entry of a not guilty verdict, the pronouncement of sentence, or imposition of probation under § 6-220 of this article.

"Forfeiting authority" means:
the unit or person designated by agreement between the State's Attorney for a county and the chief executive officer of the governing body having jurisdiction over assets subject to forfeiture to act on behalf of the governing body regarding those assets; or
if the seizing authority is a unit of the State, a unit or person that the Attorney General or the Attorney General's designee designates by agreement with a State's Attorney, county attorney, or municipal attorney to act on behalf of the State regarding assets subject to forfeiture by the State.
"Lien" includes a mortgage, deed of trust, pledge, security interest, encumbrance, or right of setoff.
"Lienholder" means a person who has a lien or a secured interest on property created before the seizure.

"Local financial authority" means:
if the seizing authority is a unit of a county, the treasurer or director of finance of the county; or
if the seizing authority is a unit of a municipal corporation, the treasurer or director of finance of that municipal corporation.

section.section: "Owner" means a person having a legal, equitable, or possessory interest in property.

text.section: "Proceeds" includes property derived directly or indirectly in connection with or as a result of a crime under the Controlled Dangerous Substances law.

section.section:
"Property" does not include:
an item unlawfully in the possession of a person other than the owner when used in connection with a crime under the Controlled Dangerous Substances law; or
a lessor's interest in property subject to a bona fide lease, unless the forfeiting authority can show that the lessor participated in a crime under the Controlled Dangerous Substances law or that the property was the proceeds of a crime under the Controlled Dangerous Substances law.
"Real property" means land or an improvement to land.

"Real property" includes:
a leasehold or other limited interest in real property;
an easement; and
a reversionary interest in a 99-year ground lease renewable forever.

text.section: "Seizing authority" means a law enforcement unit in the State that is authorized to investigate violations of the Controlled Dangerous Substances law and that has seized property under this title.
